etymologies: Old English finc, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch vink and German Fink

definitions: a seed-eating songbird that typically has a stout bill and colorful plumage.

notes.text: The true finches belong to the family Fringillidae (the finch family), which includes chaffinches, canaries, linnets, crossbills, etc. Many other finches belong to the bunting, waxbill, or sparrow families
